From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin nāvigāre.

Verb

[edit]

navegar (first-person singular indicative present navego, past participle navegáu)

  1. to sail (to ride in a boat, especially sailboat)

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of navegar
infinitive navegar
gerund navegando
past participle m navegáu, f navegada, n navegao, m pl navegaos, f pl navegaes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present navego navegues navega navegamos navegáis naveguen
imperfect navegaba navegabes navegaba navegábemos, navegábamos navegabeis, navegabais navegaben
preterite navegué navegasti, naveguesti navegó naveguemos navegastis, naveguestis navegaron
pluperfect navegare, navegara navegares, navegaras navegare, navegara navegáremos, navegáramos navegareis, navegarais navegaren, navegaran
future navegaré navegarás navegará navegaremos navegaréis navegarán
conditional navegaría navegaríes navegaría navegaríemos, navegaríamos navegaríeis, navegaríais navegaríen
subjunctive present navegue navegues, navegas navegue naveguemos naveguéis naveguen, navegan
imperfect navegare, navegara navegares, navegaras navegare, navegara navegáremos, navegáramos navegareis, navegarais navegaren, navegaran
imperative — navega — — navegái —

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin nāvigāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [nə.βəˈɣa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [nə.vəˈɣa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [na.veˈɣaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

navegar (first-person singular present navego, first-person singular preterite naveguí, past participle navegat); root stress: (Central) /ɛ/; (Valencia) /e/; (Balearic) /ə/

  1. to navigate, to sail

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of navegar (first conjugation, g-gu alternation)
infinitive navegar
gerund navegant
past participle masculine feminine
singular navegat navegada
plural navegats navegades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present navego navegues navega naveguem navegueu naveguen
imperfect navegava navegaves navegava navegàvem navegàveu navegaven
future navegaré navegaràs navegarà navegarem navegareu navegaran
preterite naveguí navegares navegà navegàrem navegàreu navegaren
conditional navegaria navegaries navegaria navegaríem navegaríeu navegarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present navegui naveguis navegui naveguem navegueu naveguin
imperfect navegués naveguessis navegués naveguéssim naveguéssiu naveguessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — navega navegui naveguem navegueu naveguin
negative (no) — no naveguis no navegui no naveguem no navegueu no naveguin

Related terms

[edit]
  • nau
  • navegable
  • navegació
  • navegador

Further reading

[edit]
  • “navegar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “navegar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “navegar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “navegar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Middle English

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

navegar

  1. alternative form of nauger

Occitan

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • navigar

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin nāvigāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [naβeˈɣa]

Verb

[edit]

navegar

  1. to navigate
    E I jorn, en setembre, preson se a navegar
    (please add an English translation of this usage example)
    (Guilhèm Anelièr, Istòria de la Guèrra de Navarra)
  2. (Internet) to surf (the Web)

Related terms

Portuguese

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • nauegar (obsolete spelling)

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin nāvigāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /na.veˈɡa(ʁ)/ [na.veˈɡa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /na.veˈɡa(ʁ)/ [na.veˈɡa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /na.veˈɡa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /na.veˈɡa(ʁ)/ [na.veˈɡa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /na.veˈɡa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /nɐ.vɨˈɡaɾ/ [nɐ.vɨˈɣaɾ]
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /nɐ.vɨˈɡaɾ/ [nɐ.vɨˈɣaɾ]
    • (Northern Portugal) IPA(key): /nɐ.bɨˈɡaɾ/ [nɐ.βɨˈɣaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /nɐ.vɨˈɡa.ɾi/ [nɐ.vɨˈɣa.ɾi]

  • Hyphenation: na‧ve‧gar

Verb

[edit]

navegar (first-person singular present navego, first-person singular preterite naveguei, past participle navegado)

  1. to navigate, sail
    • 1572, Luís de Camões, Os Lusíadas, First Canto:
      As armas, & os barões aßinalados, / Que da Occidental praya Luſitana, / Por mares nunca de antes nauegados, / Paſſaram, ainda alem da Taprobana, […]
      (please add an English translation of this quotation)
    • (Can we date this quote?), Fernando Pessoa, Navegar é Preciso‎[1]:
      Navegadores antigos tinham uma frase gloriosa: "Navegar é preciso; viver não é preciso".
      (please add an English translation of this quotation)
  2. (Internet) to surf, navigate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of navegar (g-gu alternation) (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • nave
  • navegação

See also

[edit]
  • velejar

Further reading

[edit]
  • “navegar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin nāvigāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /nabeˈɡaɾ/ [na.β̞eˈɣ̞aɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: na‧ve‧gar

Verb

[edit]

navegar (first-person singular present navego, first-person singular preterite navegué, past participle navegado)

  1. to navigate, to sail
    navegar una nave ― to navigate a ship
  2. (Internet) to surf, navigate
    navegar por Internet ― to surf the internet

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of navegar (g-gu alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive navegar
gerund navegando
past participle masculine feminine
singular navegado navegada
plural navegados navegadas

negative no navegues no navegue no naveguemos no naveguéis no naveguen

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
